page.title: 11GOVERNMENT 2-FIRE SERVICE
page.content: The fire service in Maybole is voluntary and part time. On average it is called out three or four times a week. Members carry a "pager" radio device which bleeps when they are on call. Most businesses are fitted with automatic alarms to alert the fire brigade. They also receive calls from the general public to attend domestic fires and road accidents.Their equipment has changed a lot over the past ten years with the introduction of new appliances and chemicals. These include hoses, a portable resuscitator a "porta_power" generator, and oxygen cannisters lasting 45mins each. Maybole's single station and sole engine covers Maybole, Crosshill, Kirkmichael, Straiton, Kirkoswald, Turnberry, and is support unit for Girvan. The busiest times are the
